page.title: 15ROYALTY VISITS SCHOOL
page.content: "The Masque of Athers Tun"was written by 4th year children for a national "Make a Masque" competition.The characters were ficticious, but the ballad was based on historical fact. The story told of a mediaeval masque prented by villeins of the Manors of Athers Tun and Wytheley,before the victorious King Henry V11 and his Queen Elizabeth of York, to celebrate their visit to Athers Tun in the spring 1486. In the masque the villeins told of their lives in feudal England,ruled over by Lord Thomas Carlyon.The allegory of the farmyard battle touched on the struggle for power between church and commerce,while the battle depicted the Battle of Bosworth. Presented before their Royal Highnesses the Prince and Princess of Wales and dignitaries.June 27th 1985.
